title: Combinations: Binomial Coefficients and Pascal's Triangle
contentHtml: Understanding combinations is crucial in probability theory, as it allows us to count the number of ways to select items from a set. In this card, we'll explore binomial coefficients and their relationship with Pascal's triangle.
name: Binomial Coefficient Formula" },
problemHtml: Find the number of ways to select 3 items from a set of 5 distinct objects.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Identify the values for n and k.", "mathHtml": "\(n=5\), \(k=3\)"}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Plug in the values into the formula.", "mathHtml": "\[ {5 \choose 3} = \frac{5!}{3!(5-3)!} \]"} ],
intuition: The binomial coefficient formula represents the number of ways to select k items from a set of n items, without regard to order.

subject: probability
title: Combinations: Binomial Coefficients
contentHtml:
In probability theory, combinations are a crucial concept in counting the number of ways to arrange items without regard to order.

The binomial coefficient C(n,k) represents the number of combinations of n items taken k at a time.

problemHtml: Find the number of ways to choose 3 books from a shelf with 5 novels and 2 textbooks.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Determine the total number of items", "mathHtml": "\(n = 7\)", "explanation": "The total number of items is the sum of novels and textbooks."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Calculate the binomial coefficient", "mathHtml": "\({7 \choose 3} = {7!}/{3!(7-3)!}\)", "explanation": "Apply the formula to find the number of combinations."} ],
